summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2020 discussing how to obtain information from a New Hampshire real estate attorney who handled the purchase of the property where Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested. The emails involve FBI agents and prosecutors coordinating legal strategy for bail arguments.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; was arrested at the property in question on July 2, 2020.

persons.name: Jen Marshal
persons.context: Named as a client (along with Steve Marshal) who retained the attorney to handle the purchase of the property via Granite Reality, LLC.

persons.name: Steve Marshal
persons.context: Named as a client (along with Jen Marshal) who retained the attorney to handle the purchase of the property via Granite Reality, LLC.

connections.description: Co-clients who retained the attorney to purchase the property for Granite Reality, LLC.
The entity they purchased (Granite Reality, LLC) owned the property where Maxwell was arrested.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested at the property located at 338 E. Washington Road, Bradford, NH.

events.title: Mortgage Banker's Conference
events.description: A conference in Portsmouth, NH where the attorney and an FBI agent first met.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, at 338 E. Washington Road in Bradford, New Hampshire.
The property was purchased by an entity called Granite Reality, LLC, which was represented by a New Hampshire real estate attorney.
The attorney was retained by clients named Jen and Steve Marshal to handle the purchase closing.
FBI agents and prosecutors were coordinating in July 2020 to obtain the attorney's file, potentially for use in Maxwell's bail arguments.
The attorney indicated she would cooperate but requested a proper subpoena to avoid breaching her ethical obligations.
